horsentp.physics

Class PhysicsPolygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • horsentp.physics.PhysicsPolygon
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleDisplayablePhysicsPolygon

    public class PhysicsPolygon
extends java.lang.Object
    Used for physics simulation with arbitrary shapes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PhysicsPolygon(float[] manyPoints) 
      PhysicsPolygon(float[] pointsX, float[] pointsY, int numberOfPoints)
      Creates a PhysicsPolygon from points specified by the arrays.
      PhysicsPolygon(Vector2D[] points)
      Creates a new PhysicsPolygon from an array of Vector2D objects.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PhysicsPolygon

        public PhysicsPolygon(float[] pointsX,
              float[] pointsY,
              int numberOfPoints)
        Creates a PhysicsPolygon from points specified by the arrays.
        Parameters:
        pointsX - The list of x coordinate points
        pointsY - The list of y coordinate points
        numberOfPoints - The number of points, because the program can't figure it out on its own

      • PhysicsPolygon

        public PhysicsPolygon(Vector2D[] points)
        Creates a new PhysicsPolygon from an array of Vector2D objects. It copies each one, so be cautious of using it.
        Parameters:
        points - the points to represent the PhysicsPolygon. They are copied over, not set to.

      • PhysicsPolygon

        public PhysicsPolygon(float[] manyPoints)
        Parameters:
        manyPoints - array of points to build the Polygon off of. It must be an even number of points in the format of "x1, y1, x2, y2...".

        public Vector2D[] getPoints()
        Gets the raw points.
        Returns:
        returns the UNtransformed points

      • getTransformedPoints

        public Vector2D[] getTransformedPoints()
        Gives it's points after it has been transformed. (Rotated and Translated)
        Returns:
        returns the transformed points.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(int x,
               int y)
        True is the point is inside the polygon.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the point
        y - the y coordinate of the point
        Returns:
        whether or not the point is inside the polygon
